intro: Leptosaccharum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf grass, is a genus of grasses native to Australia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plants typically grow in dry, sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Leptosaccharum species are often found in grasslands and shrublands, contributing to the ecological diversity of these habitats. They play an important role in soil stabilization and provide forage for native wildlife.
